page.title: 17More Nantwich Churches
page.content: The Methodist tradition is nearly two centuries old in Nantwich.The {Central Methodist Church}was built in 1808 after the successful visits of {John Wesley.}A flourishing Day School and Sunday School faltered after a fire. The present schoolrooms are used by the Junior Church and various community groups.The Welsh Row Church, built 150 years ago as a Primitive Methodist Chapel,merged with the former Wesleyan Circuit and now heads the Nantwich Circuit of 22 churches. The{Roman Catholic parish}of St.Anne's,part of Nantwich since 1855, now has a small modern church.Services of holy mass are well attended.The church works closely with its affiliated school which is situated close by.The Parish priest leads the community with pastoral work and has help from the Catechetical team.
